intro: Alyxia disphaerocarpa, commonly known as the red-berried alyxia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Solanaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the Gulf Coast. The plant is characterized by its woody vines and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a distinctive red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Alyxia disphaerocarpa is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as swamps and along stream banks.
